title: A problem highlighted by World Economic Forum data which put Turkey in 61st position in its 2010–2011 Global Competitiveness 192 Notes Report: Turkey benefits from its large market, which is characterized by intense local competition (15th place) and sophisticated business practices (52nd). The country also benefits from reasonably developed infrastructure (56th), particularly roads and air transport infrastructure, although ports and the electricity supply require upgrading.
